definitions.definition: able to change to suit new conditions or situations

examples.text: Our plans need to be flexible enough to cater for the needs of everyone.
You need to be more flexible and imaginative in your approach.
Can you be flexible about when you take your leave?
My mother is fairly flexible about what time I need to be home.
We need to make the working day more flexible.
A First National Bank loan is an extremely flexible facility.
What is needed is a more flexible design.
We can offer you flexible working hours.

definitions.definition: able to bend easily without breaking

examples.text: a fitness program that keeps joints flexible and mobile

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin flexibilis, from flectere ‘to bend’.
